project.android.imageprocessing
Class FastImageProcessingView

java.lang.Object
  android.view.View
      android.view.SurfaceView
          android.opengl.GLSurfaceView
              project.android.imageprocessing.FastImageProcessingView
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback
public class FastImageProcessingView
extends android.opengl.GLSurfaceView

Fast image processing view extension of GLSurfaceView. This class is required for all fast image processing activities that use this framework. With the help of the FastImageProcessingPipeline, this class provides the OpenGL context required for image processing. Set of the framework is as follows:

Add FastImageProcessingView to activity layout.

Add FastImageProcessingPipeline to FastImageProcessingView

Create a input point and attach filter chains to the input and attach endpoints to the filter chains using addTarget.

image = new GLImageToTextureRenderer(this, R.drawable.tiger);

filter = new GreyScaleFilter();

screen = new GLTextureToScreenRenderer(pipeline, true);

image.addTarget(filter);

filter.addTarget(screen);

Pass the input point into the FastImageProcessingPipeline as the root renderer and start the pipeline.

pipeline.setRootRenderer(image);

pipeline.startRendering();

Author:
Chris Batt
